posts._title: Emilio Martínez Lázaro – Las palabras de Max AKA What Max Said (1978)
posts.title: Las palabras de Max
posts.excerpt: Disquieting portrait of loneliness and isolation, concentrating on a middle-aged man (Fernandez de Castro) who has reached a crisis point in his domestic life and tries unsuccessfully to reassemble his past. The film shared the Berlin festival’s Golden Bear prize.

posts.title: Another Year
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Thirteen dinners of a Chinese migrant worker’s family over the course of fourteen months. The film portrays a series of random occurrences. Joys, frustrations and the struggle for survival. The meals unfold in real-time through thirteen static, long takes. Each take captures with vivid detail the reality of the relationships between the different family members. …

posts._title: Michèle Rosier – Mon coeur est rouge (1976)
posts.title: Mon coeur est rouge
posts.excerpt: Michèle Rosier (1930-2017) was a pioneering fashion designer (she created the vinyl-intensive V de V sportswear label), a journalist who worked as editor of the women’s lifestyle magazine Le Noveau Femina, and an avowed leftist. She also had a 40+ year career behind the camera, directing several documentaries for French television as well as a …

posts.title: Fingerprints Don’t Lie
posts.excerpt: Definite Grade B. The last in the Forgotten Noir Volume 6 series. For desperate viewers. Quote:The killing of Mayor Palmer (Forrest Taylor) is being placed on Paul Moody (Richard Emory) by fingerprint expert Jim Stover (Richard Travis) as Moody’s prints were found on the murder weapon. When reporter Brad Evans (Rory Mallison) places doubt in …

posts.title: El Topo
posts.excerpt: The gunfighter El Topo (“The Mole”) and his young son ride through a desert to a village, whose inhabitants have been massacred. Bandits are nearby, torturing and killing the survivors. El Topo rescues a woman (Mara), who leads him on a mission to find and defeat the four master gunmen of the desert. Leaving his …

posts.title: Les capricieux
posts.excerpt: In post-revolutionary France, two neighbouring aristocrats (Nicole Garcia and Jean-Pierre Marielle) embark on a dangerous game when they agree to help a Polish agent.

posts._title: Kon Ichikawa – Yukinojô henge AKA An Actor’s Revenge [+Extras] (1963)
posts.title: Yukinojô henge
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Master Director Kon Ichikawa’s 1963 classic is considered by many to be one of the finest films ever made in Japan.Kasuo Hasegawa stars as Yukinojo, a talented kabuki actor who specializes in playing female roles (women were not allowed on the stage during the period of the film). But his success on the stage is …

posts.title: Murder with Pictures
posts.excerpt: Suspected crime boss Nate Girard beats a murder rap, and newspaper photog Kent Murdock is on the story. Girard and lawyer Redfield throw a party for the news men where Murdock romances a mystery woman who confronted Girard in front of him, but Murdock’s fiancée Hester shows up. After they return to his apartment, have …

posts.title: Counsellor at Law
posts.excerpt: George Simon (played by John Barrymore in a memorable performance) has risen from his poor Jewish immigrant beginnings to become a high-powered lawyer with an office in the Empire State Building. His professional and private lives pass by at breakneck pace, and he hasn’t registered that his blueblood wife Cora (Doris Kenyon) is showing interest …

posts.title: Black Panthers
posts.excerpt: This classic 1968 documentary highlights the activities of the headquarters of the Black Panther Party in Oakland, California as its members fight for the freedom of its imprisoned co-founder Huey P. Newton.
